docs.lead_paragraph: Anthem Inc. is offering several levels of free identity theft protection to current and former customers after hackers broke into a database storing information for about 80 million people.

headline.main: Insurer Anthem Offers Layers of Identity Theft Protection
headline.print_headline: Insurer Anthem Offers Layers of Identity Theft Protection

docs.snippet: Anthem Inc. is offering several levels of free identity theft protection to current and former customers after hackers broke into a database storing information for about 80 million people.

docs.lead_paragraph: Cyberspace is the new "Wild West," President Barack Obama said Friday, with everyone looking to the government to be the sheriff. But he told the private sector it must do more to stop cyber attacks aimed at the U.S. every day.

headline.main: Obama Calls on Silicon Valley to Help Thwart Cyber Attacks
headline.print_headline: Obama Calls on Silicon Valley to Help Thwart Cyber Attacks

docs.snippet: Cyberspace is the new "Wild West," President Barack Obama said Friday, with everyone looking to the government to be the sheriff. But he told the private sector it must do more to stop cyber attacks aimed at the U.S. every day.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Responding to Republican warnings, the Democratic governor predicted a positive economic impact of $1 billion over seven years.
docs.abstract: Gov Steven L Beshear of Kentucky unveils Deloitte Consulting study predicting that state's expanded Medicaid program under Affordable Care Act will generate positive fiscal impact of nearly $1 billion over seven years; findings belie claims of state Republicans that have warned expansion would impose heavy burden on taxpayers.
docs.snippet: Responding to Republican warnings, the Democratic governor predicted a positive economic impact of $1 billion over seven years.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Will millions of kids lose health coverage because of gridlock?

headline.seo: Hillary Clinton and Bill Frist on Health Care for America’s Kids

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Hillary Rodham Clinton and Bill Frist expresses concern that Washington gridlock and jousting over Affordable Care Act will undermine continuation of Children's Health Insurance Program, initiative that provides insurance coverage to millions of American children; warns that loss of program would leave many children uninsured; urges Congress to act early to reauthorize program.
docs.snippet: Will millions of kids lose health coverage because of gridlock?

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

byline.original: By HILLARY RODHAM CLINTON and BILL FRIST

docs.lead_paragraph: Experts expressed frustration that efforts to reform the health care system so rarely relied on rigorous methods of evaluation like the one known as random assignment.

headline.main: Few Health System Studies Use Top Method, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Few Health System Studies Use Top Method, Report Says

docs.abstract: Study published in journal Science finds that majority of scientific research conducted to improve the American health care system does not utilize random assignment, methodology that is considered gold standard; finds only 18 percent of such research used the rigorous approach of random assignment in treatment trials.
docs.snippet: Experts expressed frustration that efforts to reform the health care system so rarely relied on rigorous methods of evaluation like the one known as random assignment.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The state commission recommended changes in the areas of mental health policy, school safety and gun violence prevention, and stressed that classrooms should be lockable from the inside.

headline.main: Newtown Panel’s Report Aims to Improve Safety
headline.print_headline: Newtown Panel’s Report Aims to Improve Safety

docs.abstract: Connecticut releases draft report of recommendations for preventing school shootings, over two years after Adam Lanza's deadly attack at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown; recommendations include gun control measures and policies aimed at improving mental health services.
docs.snippet: The state commission recommended changes in the areas of mental health policy, school safety and gun violence prevention, and stressed that classrooms should be lockable from the inside.

docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of people signing up for health insurance this weekend may not realize it, but their coverage under President Barack Obama's law could be short-lived.

headline.main: As Sign-Up Deadline Nears, a New Risk for Obama Health Law

headline.main: A Secret Skate-Park Clubhouse for Grown-Up Brooklynites

docs.abstract: The members-only club, built by men in their 30s and 40s, is reputed to be the largest and most elaborate of its kind in Long Island City.
